text.text: A central tenet of the company's commitment to environmental standards was to take whatever steps were required to ensure no wildlife would be disturbed. Activity continued in the area but great care was taken to ensure the nest was not disturbed. The eggs successfully hatched a few months later.

Since the historic Castle Silver mine property is a former producer, existing underground openings and surface structures had become hazards. Measures already taken include: the re-sloping of waste piles around surface openings, repairing protective fencing, and the back-filling of open shafts.
